description: a(n) is the smallest number k such that k! contains k exactly n times.
example: a(3)=313 because in 313! 313 appears exactly 3 times.
mathematica: a = Table[ -1, {12}]; Do[b = Length[ StringPosition[ ToString[n! ], ToString[n]]]; If[a[[b+1]] == -1, a[[b+1]] = n]], {n, 0, 15000} ]; a
author: Michel ten Voorde (seqfan(AT)tenvoorde.org) May 22 2001
extensions: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 09 2002
